title: Manager - Export Import (Mahape, Navi Mumbai)
tagsAndSkills: Import Management,Export Management,Import Documentation,Export Import,Gst Compliance,Trade Compliance,Freight Management,Logistics Management
jobDescription:
Position: Export Import Manager (PAN India Level)
Location: Mahape, Navi Mumbai, (Maharashtra)
Reports to: Head Supply Chain India Region
Team : (2 Contract Staff)


Import & Export Trade Compliance Specialist will be responsible for Composite Import & Trade Compliance. Broad responsibilities to the position are summarized beneath:


  • Logistics Complete Import & Export formalities from the Supplier Pick-up points to delivery points
    • Optimize freight cost/kg for inland trucking and ocean freights, AIR, Courier for Export and Import consignments.
    • Closely liaison with Custom House Agents / Freight Forwarders / Shipping Companies for time import and Export shipments without any buffer/CFS/ warehouse, Demurrage/Detention Charge.
  • Checking /Approving Export Shipping Bill and ensuring the correctness of filed S.B for closing and coordinating Banks for EDPMS Closures for E-BRCs
  • Checking / Approving the Import Bill of Entries and organizing the duty payments coordinating with Finance Teams.
  • Working and dealing knowledge with customs/DGFT and respective authorities on SIMS, BIS and SVB Compliances
  • Ensure team adheres to declarations, documentations and certificates required for exports and imports Trade Preferences and Certificates of Origins/FTA, AESAN, SAFTA etc and legalization of documents.

• Timely renewal / Re-validation/ submitting the required DATA/ Information to the statutory Authorities such as Export Inspection Agencies/ DGFT / Customs / Export Promotion Councils.

  • Complete knowledge for executing LUT/Self Sealing / E-Sealing/ Direct Port Delivery/of Export & Import Containers in compliances to the Customs Regulations
  • knowledge of Banking Letter of Credit (UDPDC-500), INCO Terms, Buyer Credit/ECGC
  • knowledge of Re-Export , Re-Import formalities, executing LUT/Self Sealing / E-Sealing/ Direct Port Delivery of Import & Export Shipments.
  • Ensuring timely custom clearances to with zero demurrages and detention.
  • Interact with Customs/Licensing authorities/EIA/DGFT with respect with import/export litigations from time to time.
  • Responsible for timely refunds of Export GST and other refunds if any from respective statutory authorities of Customs / DGFT
  • Good hold on project imports and imports of old equipment/machines (including custom valuation rules) as a Key Skill.

Responsibilities

1. Import & Export Management

  • Supervising pre shipment & post shipment export documentations
  • Negotiating Ocean freight rates with shipping companies and with various Trade Partners for logistics Function.
  • Keep track of License wise Incentives, utilization of licenses redemption of EPCG /advance license.
  • Maintain statement of advance license and track record of license and obtaining EODC.
  • Implement best operational practices and efficiently keep daily records of day-to-day activities.
  • Ensuring cordial working relations with Customs at Nhava Sheva & Mumbai Air cargo complex.

2. Trade Compliance

  • Adhere to trade compliance associated with the issuance of export and import policies, procedures, methods, and practices to facilitate better implementation of company objectives. Compliance for cross-border movements.
  • Compliances and documentation for various Foreign Trade policy benefits viz. EPCG, Advance License, RoDTEP, Refund of duty (Fixation of drawback).
  • Work closely with Regional & Global Trade Compliance team to ensure concentration on global customs regulation frameworks such as harmonized tariff schedules, customs valuations, import VAT rules for importing country and various other county specific compliance matters.

3. Indirect Taxation & GST Compliance

  • Handling below statutory audits as per local rules & regulations for
  • Attending the PH/Audits of Customs, Excise, GST, CAG, DRI, SVB etc relevant to Export & Imports.
  • Present for Special Valuation permission with GATT cell of Customs authority and for Legal matter with the Customs, Excise and Service Tax Appellate Tribunal (CESTAT).
  • Ensuring filing of various monthly & periodical returns respect to GST regime in reconciliation with Financial GL for ensuring correct presentation of returns to Tax authorities.

4. Other Knowledge and Skills:

  • Knowledge of Import, Export, Trade Compliance, Export Incentives viz. MEIS, EPCG, RoDTEP.
  • Liaison with DGFT (Director General of Foreign Trade).
  • Sound knowledge of INCO terms for Import operations like CIF, EX-works, FOB, DDP etc.
  • Good understanding on process related project imports and imports of old equipment/machines (including valuation) as a Key Skill.

MIS :

1. Maintaining Complete Track Record of Export and Import DATA

2. Maintaining the Open & Close EDPMS/IDPMS Data

3. Maintaining and monitoring the Licenses Export and Import Track records of EPCG/ADVANCE/MEIS/RoDTP Values.

4. Weekly fund forecasting of Custom Duty, Vendor Payments etc.

5. Handling Internal customs requirement to Finance/Buying/Production teams.


Qualification

  • Must possess University Degree (Commerce/Science). Post Graduate MBA/ Materials

Management, Diploma in Import & Exports, Excise.


Experience:

  • Should possess around 10-15 years of relevant experience in Import operations, Trade &

Compliance Management, in company of repute. Should have hands on experience in dealing

with Customs, DGFT , Export Inspection Agencies, DRI, SVB Cells of Indian Customs.

title: Manager - Partnerships (Social Sector) - Mumbai
tagsAndSkills: Partnerships,partner management,Partnership Management,Partner Development,Social Sector,Development,Management
jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities

  • Build network and partnership with stakeholders working for Disaster Risk Reduction and Disaster Response (including Disaster Management Agency, Disaster Management NGOs, Cyclone Shelter Community Members, Marine Police, NSS / NCC students, Panchayat Leaders, key informants from communities, humanitarian institutions) to strengthen response activities
  • Management with technical institutions for finding localized disaster management solution to mitigate disaster risks
  • Collaborate with various voluntary organizations / Community Based organizations and grassroots / youth networks to generate active participation of the vulnerable community towards raising community awareness, promotion of resilient technologies and disaster preparedness
  • Ensuring dynamic content collection for disseminating various disaster management advisories and early warnings
  • Supporting field team to strengthen partnership with appropriate authority for getting local administration support and inclusive relief distribution
  • Identify and build partnership with various universities / colleges specializing in Disaster management so as to get expertise support and students engagement for measuring outcomes of various Disaster Management initiatives
  • Share a periodical communication on partnership activities to the different agencies involved in Disaster Management activities
  • Support in coordination and communication among Disaster Risk Reduction Working Group members and with relevant government departments at various levels for effective implementation of the strategic work-plans

Preferred candidate profile

  • Minimum 3 years experience in Disaster Risk Reduction / Mitigation sector
  • Fluency in English, report preparation and presentation skills are essential
  • Experience in various stakeholders involved in effective disaster preparedness, response and recovery and able to network with those organizations
  • Experience in Logistics of Caring : Delivering Relief and Resilience
  • Work experience in connecting individuals in disaster preparedness volunteers work

Perks and benefits

Salary + Benefits
hiringFor: One of the Leading Non Profit Org.

title: Finance Head, 10+ years in Mumbai
tagsAndSkills: Rbi Reporting,Technical Audit,Problem Solving,Financial Management,Financial Operations,Finance,Financial Planning,Leadership Skills
jobDescription:
Position: Finance Head
Qualification: CA/CFA/MBA
Experience: 10+ years
Location: Mumbai

Roles and responsibility:

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement financial strategies to drive business growth
  • Lead financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting processes
  • Oversee accounting, treasury, and financial reporting functions
  • Manage relationships with investors, banks, and other financial partners
  • Ensure compliance with financial regulations and standards
  • Drive cost optimization and process improvement initiatives
  • Provide financial insights and analysis to support business decisions
  • Control the expenses and drive operational efficiency

Transaction reconciliation and settlement:

  • Oversee the 3-way reconciliation between transactions reports, bank settlement files and escrow entries on a daily basis by settlement cycle
  • Oversee the fund management and ensure settlements to the merchants are made as per the agreed terms and ensure the banks/aggregators settle the amount to escrow on time
  • Oversee the management of chargebacks and refunds resolution

Revenue Management:

  • Define the policy for merchant fees by MCC along with the Business head and Head of risk
  • Monitoring of the merchant rates and profitability on a periodic basis
  • Support the banking alliance in pricing negotiations with banks/aggregators for different payment modes
  • Implementing accounting policies to recognize revenue from transactions and services in accordance with accounting standard
  • Generating and managing invoices for merchant services, including subscription and transaction-based fees.
  • Ensure compliance on collections for post-paid billing


Compliance and risk management

  • Ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements specific to the payment industry in India, such as those set by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards (PCI DSS).
  • Coordinating with internal and external auditors to conduct regular financial audits and ensure compliance with accounting standards and regulations


Qualifications

  • 10+ years of experience in finance, preferably in the payment industry
  • Knowledge of financial technology and payment systems
  • CA/CFA/MBA or equivalent qualification
  • Strong financial management and leadership skills
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Experience with financial planning, accounting, and treasury functions
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • The candidate should have experience in setting up and managing financial operations team
  • The candidate should have a good knowledge around the RBI regulations on online payment aggregator
  • The candidate should have experience completing regulatory and technical audits
